intro: Conomorpha myriantha, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, violet to purple flowers that bloom in the summer months. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens in temperate climates.
